page.title: 07Mr. Elgey's Farm AA
page.content: Mr. Elgey has farmed at{Low Fields}for 25 years and he rents it and he was born on the farm. The{farmhouse}is 240 years old and the farm is 81 hectares. Mr. Elgey's{crops}are wheat, barley, potatoes, strawberries, redcurrants, raspberries, gooseberries, peas, rape and grass. The{livestock}he keeps are sheep and he has gone out of cattle and pigs but he has gone into arable and grown more crops. Mr. Elgey has 30 acres of{fruit and {vegetables.}He started growing fruit in 1971. He first grew strawberries. People come from Darlington to pick Mr. Elgey's fruit.It is all "pick your own". 30 tonnes of fruit and 15 tonnes of vegetables are picked each year. When Mr.Elgey started growing fruit the problems he had were weeds and insects. The picking season each year is 4-5 weeks.
